All rights reserved. About US 18 Years of Leadership in Extended Stay Investments Sandpiper Lodging Trust is a real estate investment trust specializing in extended stay hotels. Â With 30 properties and operational excellence, our goal is to grow SLTâs portfolio of best-in-class extended stay hotel assets, with a focus in our target markets across the United States, to create current income and capital appreciation, and to ultimately provide liquidity for shareholders through the sale of assets, a recapitalization, or via a public listing of our common shares. Investment Thesis Our focus on the extended stay hotel market is driven by its unmatched investment potential. This segment stands out for its strong guest value, few entrenched competitors, and positive balance between supply and demand. Proven resilient during economic downturns, including the COVID-19 pandemic, extended stay hotels cater to work-related travelers, long-term guests, and value-conscious customers. By prioritizing our focus on this segment, we are able to deliver consistent cash flow, attractive shareholder returns, and long-term capital appreciation, ensuring sustainable growth and differentiation in the hospitality sector. Our History & Past Performance Our extended stay hotel strategy thrives because it addresses specific guest needs: Mandatory work-related travel, alternatives to traditional housing, and value-driven choices during challenging economic times. This resilience has been a cornerstone of our continued performance and investor satisfaction. Explore Sandpiper Vehicles, Performance, and Portfolio MEET OUR TEAM At Sandpiper, our strength lies in our people. Each member of our team brings a unique blend of skills, expertise, and passion that drives our success and innovation. We pride ourselves on assembling a group of talented professionals who are not only leaders in their fields but also dedicated to our vision of providing exceptional service and solutions for The Sandpiper Companies. The Company is managed by the Managing Member and sponsor, Sandpiper, LLC, which is wholly-owned by P. Carter Rise. Mr. Rise has been successfully developing and managing extended stay hotels since his initial foray into the hospitality business in 2008. Over the past 17 years, he has built a very successful platform of high-performing hotels consisting of 39 assets, 16 of which we developed from the ground-up. LEADERSHIP ASSOCIATES Carter Rise President, Chief Executive Officer, and Chairman Carter Rise has served as President, CEO, and Chairman of the Board of Sandpiper since its inception. Mr. Rise is the founder and sole member of Sandpiper, LLC, the Managerâs majority owner and controlling member, and the sole common shareholder and a significant preferred shareholder in each of the Sandpiper funds. Mr. Rise also is the majority owner of Sandpiper Hospitality, a hotel management company. Since 2012, Mr. Rise has served on WoodSpring Suites Franchise Advisory Council, and is currently serving his fourth term as its Chairman. From 2001 to 2008, Mr. Rise was a Founder and Managing Partner of Scura, Rise & Partners, LLC, an investment banking boutique based in New York, NY. Prior to 2001, Mr. Rise was an investment banker for 13 years with Prudential Securities, Inc. and its predecessor company, Prudential-Bache, Inc., where he served as Managing Director and Group Head of the Financial Services Group. Mr. Rise has an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a B.S. from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia. John Austin Chief Financial Officer John Austin has served as the Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, and Secretary of Sandpiper since its inception in June 2018 after serving as a consultant of Sandpiper. Mr. Austin is responsible for managing all financial functions for the Sandpiper affiliates. Prior to Sandpiper, Mr. Austin was the Chief Financial Officer of The Chefâs Warehouse, Inc., a publicly traded foodservice distributor, from 2012 to 2017, after having served on the Board of Directors from 2011 to 2012. From 2009 to 2012, Mr. Austin was a founder and former Chief Financial Officer of the HILB Group, LLC, an insurance broker in Richmond, Virginia. Mr. Austin worked at Performance Food Group Company (âPFGâ), a Richmond-based publicly traded foodservice distributor, for over 14 years, serving a portion of his time as their CFO. Mr. Austin was integrally involved in leading the company through the process of going private and the divestiture of a major business segment that created significant shareholder value. Mr. Austin holds a B.S. in Accounting from the University of Delaware. Andy Anderson Chief Acquisition Officer Andy Anderson joined Sandpiper in June 2018 as Chief Acquisitions Officer, after serving as a consultant to the company. Mr. Anderson focuses on identifying and completing strategic hotel acquisitions for Sandpiper and assists with legal and capital market requirements. Mr. Anderson most recently served as the Executive Vice President of Corporate Development for WoodSpring Suites Hotels, where he was responsible for the activities of the brandâs large-scale developers nationwide and internal and external acquisitions. Mr. Anderson has more than 30 years of real estate transactional experience derived from his roles as a partner at Sandman and Savrann, a national law firm specializing in the hospitality industry, General Counsel of Mid America Real Estate Companies, Granite Golf, and his years in private practice. He also leverages over 20 years of business development in the hospitality industry and has been a critical part of business development teams for GE Capital Solutions â Hospitality Finance, Citi Hospitality Finance, Troon Golf and WoodSpring Suite Hotels. Mr. Anderson graduated with honors from the University of Tulsa College of Law and graduated Cum Laude from Northern Illinois University. Ned Sinnott Managing Director, Capital Markets, Equity Investments & Investor Relations Ned Sinnott joined Sandpiper in September 2012 as Managing Director. Mr. Sinnott oversees investor relations and equity investments for the Company. Mr. Sinnott is a key member of our management team and has been responsible for overseeing capital raising efforts that have resulted in over $260 million in equity investments for the Company and other Sandpiper entities. Further, he was responsible for identifying and securing all real estate sites for Sandpiper Hospitality IV, LLC and Sandpiper Hospitality V, LLC. Mr. Sinnott has held several sales and management positions over his 25-year career. Most recently, from 2006 to 2012, he was a Senior Vice President in Institutional Equity Sales with Davenport & Company and Wunderlich Securities, covering major institutional accounts in New York, Connecticut, North Carolina, Tennessee and Virginia. Mr. Sinnott has a B.A. in History from the University of Virginia. Carter Rise Jr. Vice President of Development Carter Rise Jr. joined Sandpiper in February 2022 as Vice President of Development. Mr. Rise is responsible for identifying and managing the development of new hotel opportunities for the company on a national basis. Prior to Sandpiper, Mr. Rise served as a Managing Consultant within IBM Global Business Services. During his 5 years at IBM, Mr. Rise focused primarily on providing data analytics, process automation, and asset management work to clients in the Federal Government and Healthcare sectors, including the DOD and DOJ. Mr. Rise holds a B.A. in Political Economy with a minor in Business Administration from Georgetown University. Peter Burke Senior Vice President of Construction & Capital Expenditures Peter Burke joined Sandpiper in May 2023 as the Senior Vice President â Construction and Capital Expenditures. Mr. Burke is responsible for new hotel construction projects on a national basis with emphasis on the new ECHO brand properties for Wyndham and Embassy Suites for Hilton. Mr. Burke is also a key member of the Sandpiper Hospitality senior management team coordinating all Capital Expenditures and PIPâs (Product Improvement Plans) for existing hotel renovations across the entire national portfolio. Prior to Sandpiper, Mr. Burke most recently spent 17 years as the Director of Facilities for Gold Key/ PHR Hotels and Resorts based in Virginia Beach, VA and was instrumental in the completion of the Cavalier Resort Complex on the Virginia Beach Oceanfront. This three-hotel complex consisted of the newly renovated historic Cavalier Hotel circa 1927 (which is part of the Marriott Autograph brands), the new 305 room full-service Marriott Virginia Beach Oceanfront Resort and the new 157 room Embassy Suites Virginia Beach by Hilton along with the Cavalier Beach Club. Throughout those 17 years, Mr. Burke was involved in the construction and renovations of multiple hotels and timeshare properties to include two 300 room, full-service Hiltonâs (Virginia Beach Oceanfront and Hilton Norfolk The Main), as well as several mixed use retail locations, apartments, warehouse, central laundry facility and IT Data Centers along with 17 restaurants. Mr. Burke is a graduate of Villanova University and received his masterâs degree in management from Troy University. He achieved the following professional designations: CHFE (Certified Hospitality Facility Executive), FMA (Facility Management Administrator) and FMP (Facility Management Professional). Additionally, Mr. Burke is a military veteran having served in the Navy on several Amphibious Ships, Naval Special Warfare and a tour in the Pentagon. Nick Anders Vice President of Acquisitions Nick Anders joined Sandpiper in July 2021 as a Financial Analyst. His responsibilities include providing analytical support for the acquisition, development, and financing activities of the companyâs portfolio. Nick started his career in commercial real estate at the CoStar Group here in Richmond, VA, serving as a market researcher for the CRE information provider. From there, he moved to Atlantic Union Bank where he served on the credit side, helping underwrite prospective loans and providing maintenance and due diligence on existing facilities. Nick graduated from Washington & Lee University with a B.A. in Economics in 2019. SLTâs 30 hotels are managed by Sandpiper Hospitality (âSHâ), our affiliated hotel management company. SH also manages 35+ additional hotels for affiliated and non-affiliated third-party owners. Jim Darter President & CEO As a lifelong hotelier and business leader, Jim takes great pride in his ability to effectively utilize and balance strategic thinking, or IQ, and resonant leadership, or EQ, to lead Sandpiper Hospitality. These complimentary abilities combine to provide Sandpiper with the horsepower, collectively through his team and his strategies, it needs to maximize returns for its investors. At the end of the day, Jim knows that, âOur strategic decisions must drive our hotels to earn better than expected returns for our investors. Period.â â Jimâs leadership of the organization takes many forms, including; a resolute focus on adding and keeping genuine talent with the right abilities and mindset, setting a vision that inspires and energizes the leaders in the organization, nailing the strategic planning for the company and the individual hotels and obsessing over results, returns and the related trends. The ROI is clear and evidentâ¦â¦internally with associate growth and development, customer-facing through guest satisfaction, and financially for the investors and owners. âWe have to earn it every day, in every way,â according to Jim â Before joining Sandpiper, Jimâs perpetual drive served him well in Denver, CO as a Senior Vice President with Sage Hospitality for fourteen years and more recently as Chief Operating Officer for Gold Key/PHR. Jim also served as a Regional Director with IHG franchise operations after learning the hotel business on property with various leadership positions at a number of award-winning hotels in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Washington DC and South Florida. At home, he is perpetually surrounded by his âgirls,â including his wife and two teenage daughters. â Tasked with executing the companyâs growth plans, Jim is equally focused on todayâs results and tomorrowâs opportunities. These parallel paths have set Sandpiper up for an explosive growth period in the coming years. âOur continued growth and expansion of brands and geography is coming as a result of our ability to perform. According to Jim, âOur dedication to excellence in people, strategy and performance is our formula to success. We play to win!â

We play to win!â Amy Howland Senior Vice President of Operations Amy first started her career in Hospitality 21 years ago as a part-time front desk weekend associate and fell in love with the industry. She found her passion to be in operations and began her journey in roles such as Executive Housekeeper, Assistant General Manager, and General Manager before progressing to above property support. She has worked for many of the Hospitality Industry leaders as Aimbridge, Naples Hotel Group, Hawkeye Hotels, and most recently with Shaner Hotel Group as Regional Vice President of Operations. As leader of Sandpiper Hotel and Operations Team, she is All In for delivering consistent results and driving strong ROI for our investors by supporting our leaders to be the best of the best. She is new to Sandpiper Hospitality leadership and brings energy to her role and strategic thinking to challenge us in taking better to best. Her passion is investing in people and challenging them to have the confidence to believe in themselves and continue to grow their career in hospitality. When Amy is not at work she enjoys spending time with her husband and fur dogs, Gnocchi & Millie. You can oftentimes find her on an adventure with her three beautiful Grandchildren whom she is known to as Nana. She has proudly served on the Board of Directors for the American Cancer Society and looks forward to getting involved in the Richmond Relay for Life and giving back to her new Community. â Victor Cruz Senior Vice President Of Business Development & Transitions Victor Cruz joined Sandpiper in 2016, bringing a broad range of hospitality revenue knowledge to the organization. Â His previous experience includes Winegardner & Hammons, Shaner Hotels, Highgate Hotels, Interstate Hotels & Resorts, Sage Hospitality and The Prococcianti Group. Â In 2011 and 2012, he was named Marriottâs Revenue Leader of the Year for the Eastern Region. Â His brand experience also includes Hilton, Starwood, IHG and WoodSpring brands. In Victorâs first year with the company, Sandpiper was recognized with the Highest RevPAR Award for all the management companies in the WoodSpring Suites brand, a feat no doubt due to Victorâs leadership and capability. Victor focuses on maximizing revenue, profits and market share penetration through aggressive yield management strategies and tactics. His genuine likeability and smarts have earned high marks for Sandpiper, as he gives GMs and owners the âA-Ha!â moment that result in increased revenue AND profit. Those are the type of results that make for happier investors, associates and guests. â John Barrar Senior Vice President of IT and Systems Integration John has a deep background in technology that started in the fifth grade, writing video games in BASIC on a TI-99/4A computer. John received a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Stephen F. Austin State University and serves on the Advisory Board for that department today. Before joining Sandpiper Hospitality, John helped Capital One grow from an unknown company to become the 6th largest bank in the United States. Most recently, he shifted his focus to Managed Services for small to medium-sized businesses. With each step, John aimed to get closer to the individual users of technology. As a technology evangelist, John gets satisfaction from helping others use and enjoy technology, trying to fulfill the promise of the Information Age. As a Board Member of the Richmond Technology Council rvatech, John actively promotes technology in the community and never misses an opportunity to share his passion Candace M. Reynolds Vice President of Human Resources Candace leads our Corporate Human Resources team, leveraging her fabulous people skills and knack for finding the right people to joinâand grow withinâthe organization. She is well-versed in hospitality HR, bringing over 25 years of experience from brands such as Marriott Vacation Worldwide, Starwood Hotels & Resorts, HEI, and Interstate Hotels. Candace was drawn to Sandpiper because of the unique opportunity to use her years of know-how to put her own thumbprint on the entire organization during its growth phase. She focuses on bringing in the perfect complement of talent, from GenX to XYZ to Baby Boomers. She aims for diversity and inclusion and always keeps in mind how Sandpiper associates create a successful bond to each other, guests, partners and investors. Her aim is to have significant, positive impact on those who spend their time with SANDPIPER HOSPITALITY so that they can in turn impact the lives of those we serve â our guests and our investors. When sheâs not at work or with her teenage son, sheâs at work in the community, often cooking for a rehabilitation center. In her words, âIt allows me to show people seeking help that they will not be judged.â â Carrie Johnson Vice President of Revenue Management Carrie graduated from the University of Lynchburg in 2003, and shortly thereafter started her career in hospitality. Spending the next 15 years in Washington, DC, Carrie worked her way through the hotel industry with Marriott, Starwood and several independent hotels in the City. She recently joined Sandpiper and will oversee the portfolio of Extended Stay America hotels from a Revenue Management standpoint. In her spare time, she spends time with her dog Clover hiking, camping and exploring the outdoors near Richmond, VA. â Tiffany Lewis Vice President of Sales & Marketing Tiffany Lewis joined Sandpiper in 2023 after having a successful 20+ years in sales within the hospitality industry. She has experience with various Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and IHG brands including full-service, select service and extended stay. As an award-winning Hospitality Sales Professional, she credits her successes to the contributions of her teams and commits her leadership efforts to developing her fellow team members. Tiffanyâs teams have come to know her as being an innovative, engaging and supportive leader who fosters a culture of excellence and achieves outstanding results William Daniels Vice President of Finance William has over 25 years of accounting, operational, and financial management experience with independent luxury brands, as well as brands such as Hilton, Holiday Inn, Marriott, Omni, and Sheraton. Previously, heâs held a Regional Director of Finance and General Manager position for Meristar and Sage Hospitality. As a Regional Director of Finance, William oversaw the accounting departments for properties in the state Indiana; Tennessee, where he oversaw the opening of the Marriott Vanderbilt hotel; and Kentucky at the famous historic Hilton Seelbach. During his time at Sage Hospitality, William was responsible for hotel openings, regional accounting, and the PMS and POS conversion of 11 indoor water-resort hotels. Later on, his experience grew again at the Hotel Madeline Resort and Inn at Lost Creek in Telluride, CO and Omni Montelucia Resort in Scottsdale, AZ. For the past four years, William has enjoyed the opportunity to work as a General Manager for the Courtyard Marriott and Four Points brand where he received awards in both Financial Performance and Brand Standards. Now at Sandpiper, William is proud to be a part of a family that never stops adding innovation to the hospitality industry. â Operations Sales & Marketing Revenue Management Talent Acquisition Other Support Select Team Category Operations Sales & Marketing Revenue Management Talent Acquisition Other Support Operations Sales & Marketing Revenue Management Construction & Capital Human Resources Brad Garrett Regional Sales Manager Brad started his career as a sales manager for Sunburst Hospitality in 1998. In 2000, he joined Wyndham Vacation, where he sold and managed sales lines. Brad also served as the Program Manager for Wyndham Vacationâs $50 million dollar Exit Program called Discovery. Later, in 2010, he became a Regional Sales Director at Extended Stay America, and there, he created the GSR Superstar Sales Program, which evolved into the companywide Reach for Rewards Program. This program became the largest revenue-producing initiative in Extended Stay Americaâs history, generating over $350 million a year in qualified leads. In 2012, Brad was promoted to Director, National Account Sales, overseeing an $80 million dollar portfolio. Subsequently, in 2018, he joined Hotel Management Services as a Regional Sales Director, responsible for 12 hotels in the Southeast. Brad furthered his journey in 2023 by becoming a Regional Sales Manager at Sandpiper Hospitality. An ambitious sales leader, Brad passionately embraces the art of sales. He collaborates with hotel teammates to devise strategies that drive new revenue, consistently exceeding budgets for hotel owners. Working with people and ensuring clear goal comprehension, he executes plans of action with precision. Brad adopts various sales styles to prospect, manage, and achieve goals that surpass budgeted expectations. With over twenty-five years of experience in the hospitality industry, Bradâs expertise and dedication continue to shine. â Brandon Bellamy Area Director of Sales Brandon began his hospitality journey back in 2011 working as a front desk agent for Woodspring Suites (formally known as Value Place) in Columbus, Ga. He worked his way up to property manager, and after a few years he found his calling with Sandpiper Hospitality in late 2013 in the role of General Manager for the newly constructed WoodSpring Suites Manassas, VA location. Throughout his journey with the hospitality company, he has been awarded numerous awards within the brand; these include WoodSpring Suites hotel brand champion, Mentor of the Year, and Sandpiper Cup Champion. Takingadvantage of opportunities in the Atlanta, GA market, Brandon has transitioned from the General Manager role into the Area Director of Sales role. Daniel Bustos Regional Manager Daniel was born and raised in the great state of Nevada. Having grown up in Vegas, it was very natural to begin in the service industry. Daniel did so while in school, prior to joining the military, and when he returned from military service. Daniel joined the Army National Guard in 2008 and trained as a Military Police officer in Fort Leonard Wood, MO. He deployed with the 137th Military Police Detachment to Afghanistan in 2010 in support of Operation Enduring Freedom. After his year-long deployment and making his way back home to Vegas, Daniel rejoined the team at the Holiday Inn. He has embraced the hospitality industry ever since. Daniel is proud to have worked in all line level positions for both the Front & Back of the house, later developing as a leader. He has worked with IHG, Wyndham, Marriott, and Choice branded hotels, becoming a General Manager in 2016. Daniel was welcomed into the Sandpiper Family in the beginning of 2024 as a Task Force General Manager, and later in 2024 he was promoted to Regional Manager.
